title: Halley's Comet
summary: Halley's Comet or Comet Halley, officially designated 1P/Halley,[1] is a short-period comet visible from Earth every 75â€“76 years.[1][10][11][12] Halley is the only known short-period comet that is regularly visible to the naked eye from Earth, and thus the only naked-eye comet that can appear twice in a human lifetime.[13]  Halley last appeared in the inner parts of the Solar System in 1986 and will next appear in mid-2061.[14]
